{"step_by_step_thinking": "The 4-digit formula for dental instruments refers to the width, length, and angle of the blade. The first digit refers to the width of the blade, the second digit refers to the length of the blade, the third digit refers to the angle of the blade, and the fourth digit refers to the angle of the cutting edge. If the instrument with primary cutting edge is perpendicular to the blade, it means that the angle of the cutting edge is 90 degrees. This is represented by the fourth digit in the formula.", "answer_choice": "D. 4th digit of 4 digit formula omitted."}
